SEARCH
Module org.example.eiscuno
Package org.example.eiscuno.model.game

Class GameUno

java.lang.Object
org.example.eiscuno.model.game.GameUno
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, IGameUno
public class GameUno extends Object implements IGameUno, Serializable
The GameUno class implements the core logic for a UNO card game session, managing the state and interactions between a human player, a machine player, the deck of cards, and the table. It provides methods to start the game, handle card drawing, playing cards, managing the "UNO" call, and determining the end of the game.

This class implements the IGameUno interface and is serializable.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Initializing the game with players, deck, and table
  • Distributing cards to players at the start
  • Allowing players to draw cards from the deck
  • Handling the play of cards onto the table
  • Managing the "UNO" call and its consequences
  • Tracking the current turn and determining when the game is over

Example usage: 

     GameUno game = new GameUno(humanPlayer, machinePlayer, deck, table);
     game.startGame();
